III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
R 400.4152 Initial documentation
At time of admission, all of the following shall be in the resident’s
case record:
2

(c) A brief description of the resident’s preparation for placement
and general physical and emotional state at the time of
admission.
The facility accepts referrals from its other programs operating on separate
licenses. Initial documentation pertaining to this subrule is documented at time of
their initial detention placement on the intake management plan, and not
documented when placed in the open or secure treatment programs. It is noted
that consultation was given to the facility at time of the 04/06/2021 interim
inspection.
R 400.4144 Admission health screening; physical examinations.
(1) An initial health screening shall be completed for each resident
within 24 hours of admission to a facility.
The facility accepts referrals from its other programs operating on separate
licenses. The admission health screen is documented at time of their initial
detention placement, and not updated when placed in the open or secure
treatment programs.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
R 400.4128 Initial staff orientation and ongoing staff training.
(1) The licensee shall provide an orientation program for new
employees. Job shadowing shall not be the only form of
orientation.
New staff receive a comprehensive orientation though its documentation is difficult
to determine compliance. Multiple forms and face sheet were required to
determine compliance. It is recommended that each staff employee training
record contain one orientation sign-off sheet denoting the topics covered and
hours completed.
3

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 2 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
SIR#2022C0219025 completed on 04/22/2022 cited the facility for inconsistent 15-
minute bed-checks and discharge planning. The CAP appears to have been
successful as no repeat citations are noted.
SIR#2022C0137026 completed on 06/30/2022 cited the facility for line-of-sight
supervision. The CAP appears to have been successful as no repeat citations are
noted.
Financial Overview
Not required due to being a governmental institution.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Facility is noted as being PREA compliant per self-report and notes the facility has
not yet been formally audited.
Chief Administrator Assessment
Facility completed its regular chief administrator assessment from 02/2022 through
02/2023.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff report being supported by management.
Youth report receiving services and supported.
Description of Agency Walk Through
Facility is clean, organized and programming implemented.
4

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
